channel.title: My Research Blog
channel.description: Recent content on My Research Blog

item.title: About Me
item.description: I’m a Malware Analyst at Check Point and a Computers Engineering student at Technion in Israel. Passionate about everything related to cybersecurity, especially about malware and vulnerabilty research. disclaimer: Everything I post on this blog is done on my free time. This blog is not related to my employer.

item.title: Gomorrah Stealer
item.description: A new version of cracked Gomorrah builder was leaked today so I thought this might be a good subject for my first publish on this blog. sha1:31da10dc30dc6a785fa71e9433feffef7e58e8a6 Some Background Gomorrah is a stealer that made its first appearance around March 2020. its written in a .NET language and almost doesn’t use any obfuscation or anti-debugging techniques, thus making it fairly easy to reverse and analyze it. First Look After executing the builder we can see a simple window with a textbox and one button.
